item.title: Last CDWG of the Quarter
item.description: The last meeting will be used to discuss how this quarter went and discuss set up for next quarters CDWG meetings.

item.title: TBD
item.description: The first meeting of CDWG will be used to introduce its members and reboot the working group. A general discussion of the goals of the group as well as upcoming topics in brown bag, professional development, research talks and workshops will be discussed.

item.title: Research Plan Development
item.description: This week’s meeting will be focused on Research Plan Development and will be led by Christine Leibbrand the Training Director of CSDE and past CSDE Fellow. The research plan will be developed in alignment with NIH K-award type framework. We will reserve one-two meetings a quarter to work on and workshop research plans each quarter.

item.title: Meet a Data Scientist - Ben Hanowell
item.description: Bio Ben Hanowell is an anthropologist, data analyst, and quantitative modeler. His research and entrepreneurship has been funded by the National Science Foundation, National Institute for Child Health and Development, and a Fulbright Scholarship. After getting his Masters in Biocultural Anthropology at University of Washington and almost completing a PhD in the same, he has worked as a data scientist since 2014 at companies including Redfin, A Place for Mom, and AWS.

item.title: BB - Brown Bag
item.description: BB is group meetings centered around group discussion or workshopping activities. This includes workshoping papers, research ideas, research plans etc. The first week of every quarter will be reserved for graduate students to write up a research plan for their graduate studies and/or updating their previously written plan.

item.title: RT - Research Talk
item.description: RT cover any area of current research that is of interest to computational demography (broadly defined).

item.title: Welcome to CDWG
item.description: The first meeting of CDWG will be used to introduce its members and reboot the working group. A general discussion of the goals of the group as well as upcoming topics in brown bag, professional development, research talks and workshops will be discussed.

item.title: PD - Professional Development
item.description: PD is group meetings centered around an internal or external speaker who will discuss oppertunities and experiences in academic, industry and non-profit sectors.

item.title: WS - Workshops
item.description: WS are dedicated to teaching new methods and models in demography and social sciences. This will focus on statistics and computational methods applied to demographic and health problems.

item.title: M - Miscellaneous
item.description: M are are uncatagorized activities that relate to Computational Demography.
